main_definition: Lying refers to the act of giving false information or deceiving someone intentionally.

meanings_and_examples.example: She was caught lying about where she had been last night.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Creating a false representation of reality, often metaphorically.
meanings_and_examples.example: He felt like he was living in a world full of lies and deceit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To present something as true when it is not, typically to avoid blame or punishment.
meanings_and_examples.example: The politician tried to lie his way out of the controversy by denying any wrongdoing.
